data.enText: a person who buys and sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports goods
data.chText: 商人；批发商；（尤指）进出口批发商

data.enText: builders' merchants (= who sell supplies to the building trade)

data.chText: 煤炭 / 葡萄酒批发商

data.enText: Venice was once a city of rich merchants.
data.chText: 威尼斯曾是富商云集的城市。

data.enText: a person who likes a particular activity
data.chText: （某活动的）爱好者；热衷于…的人

data.enText: a speed merchant (= sb who likes to drive fast)
noise merchants (= for example, a band who make a lot of noise)
a person who predicts that things will go very badly
The prophets of doom who said television would kill off the book were wrong.
data.chText: 认为电视会扼杀书籍的悲观预言家完全错了。

data.enText: connected with the transport of goods by sea
a person who predicts that things will go very badly
The prophets of doom who said television would kill off the book were wrong.
data.chText: 认为电视会扼杀书籍的悲观预言家完全错了。

tr: a businessperson engaged in retail trade

example.ex: Any knowledgeable wine merchant would be able to advise you.
example.tran: 任何一个懂行的葡萄酒商人都可以给你提出建议。

value.def: A merchant is a person who buys or sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports them.

example.ex: The family was forced to live on credit from local merchants.
example.tran: 这家人不得不靠向当地商人赊账生活。

value.def: A merchant is a person who owns or runs a shop, store, or other business.

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 retailer, shopkeeper

example.ex: There's been a big reduction in the size of the British merchant fleet in recent years.
example.tran: 近些年来英国商船队伍的规模大为缩减。

value.def: Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade.

trans: 耍赖擦车仔(停车时不待车主允许便去擦挡风玻璃然后伸手要钱)

partsOfSpeech.d: 申请人(尤指求职、进高等学校等)
partsOfSpeech.dec: ap- 朝,向 + plic 重叠,折叠 + -ant 某种人
im- 在内,进入,使 + migr- 移动,迁移 + -ant 某种人
inhabit v.居住于 + -ant 某种人
parti- 部分,分开 + cip 拿,抓住,获取 + -ant 某种人
account 计算,算账 + -ant 某种人
